qas.question: How can the location and amount of insects be changed?
What is one thing that can be used to pull pests?
What is the name of the process by which pests are attracted and repelled using IPM.
When was the term semiochemcial stimuli established?
What is one thing that makes people want to buy products they don't need?
What is easier to grow than normal plants?
What was created in 1987 to add to food so they will last longer on the shelf?
What do marketers use in commercials to get people to buy their products?

context: The term "push-pull" was established in <b4_0>1987<b4_0/> as an approach for <a0_0>integrated pest management<a0_0/> (IPM). This strategy uses a mixture of <a1_0><b5_0>behavior-modifying stimuli<b5_0/><a1_0/> to manipulate the distribution and abundance of insects. "Push" means the insects are repelled or deterred away from whatever resource that is being protected. "Pull" means that certain stimuli (semiochemical stimuli, pheromones, <a2_0><b7_0>food additives<b7_0/><a2_0/>, <b8_0>visual stimuli<b8_0/>, <b6_0>genetically altered plants<b6_0/>, etc.) are used to attract pests to trap crops where they will be killed. There are numerous different components involved in order to implement a <a3_0>Push-Pull<a3_0/> Strategy in IPM.
